title: Government Agency Data
text0: A comprehensive repository of openly accessible data from various sources within Bangladesh, providing valuable insights across diverse domains.
text1: Curated by the Bangladesh Bureau of Statistics, this organized collection presents statistical data covering a wide range of demographic, economic, and social indicators.
text2: Within the Dhaka Stock Exchange, this database holds financial and market-related information on publicly traded companies in Bangladesh.
text3: Focused on promoting exports, this database provides information on export-oriented industries, trade policies, and market opportunities in Bangladesh.
text4: Tailored for exporters, this specialized database offers insights into export-related regulations, procedures, and market intelligence.
text5: Designed for importers, this dedicated repository offers insights into import regulations, tariffs, and trade policies, facilitating smooth import processes.
text6: Managed by the Bangladesh Water Development Board, this hydrology-focused database offers insights into water-related data, including river flows, rainfall patterns, and water resource management.
text7: Governed by the Bangladesh Power Development Board, this database holds information related to power generation, distribution, and consumption.
text8: A comprehensive environmental database providing insights into various aspects of the environment, including pollution levels, biodiversity, and conservation efforts.
text9: Dedicated to monitoring climate-related activities, this database focuses on Monitoring, Reporting, and Verification (MRV) of greenhouse gas emissions in Bangladesh.
text10: Functioning as an Electronic Document Management System (EDMS), this system efficiently manages and organizes electronic documents, facilitating retrieval, storage, and collaboration.
text11: Focused on climate change, this knowledge management system aggregates, organizes, and disseminates information on climate change impacts and mitigation strategies.
text12: Compiling the legal framework, this database encompasses statutes, regulations, and legal documents shaping the Laws of Bangladesh.
text13: Managing information related to foreign aid, this system ensures transparency and accountability in aid utilization and distribution - the Aid Information Management System.

title: International and US Agency Data
text0: A comprehensive database provided by the World Bank, offering a wealth of economic, social, and environmental data from countries around the world.
text1: The IMF database contains economic and financial data, including global economic outlooks, exchange rates, and financial stability reports.
text2: The ILO database focuses on labor-related statistics, providing insights into employment trends, wages, and working conditions globally.
text3: A database by the World Trade Organization (WTO) containing international trade statistics, tariff data, and information on trade agreements between member countries.
text4: This database facilitates international trade by providing market intelligence, trade statistics, and business solutions to promote sustainable and inclusive development.
text5: Managed by the International Food Policy Research Institute, this dataverse contains datasets related to global food policy, agriculture, and nutrition.
text6: A repository of data compiled by UNICEF, offering information on child health, education, nutrition, and other indicators to monitor the well-being of children worldwide.
text7: The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) database provides socio-economic and development-related data, supporting global efforts to reduce poverty and promote sustainable development.
text8: NASA's Worldview offers satellite imagery and data visualizations, providing a comprehensive view of Earth's climate, atmosphere, and environmental changes.
text9: A database offering global economic data, including GDP, population, and price indices, to support research and analysis in the field of international economics.
text10: This database collects and analyzes data on human values and beliefs from societies around the world, offering insights into cultural and social trends.
text11: EM-DAT is a global database on natural and technological disasters, providing detailed information on individual disasters, their impact, and response efforts.
text12: Managed by the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD), this database offers comprehensive trade statistics, including data on trade flows and economic indicators.
text13: The ADB Data repository is a comprehensive source of economic, financial, and social data, offering valuable insights into the development landscape of Asian and Pacific countries. Providing a wide array of indicators, it serves as a crucial resource for researchers, policymakers, and practitioners, fostering informed decision-making and sustainable development initiatives.

title: Microdata Surveys
text0: IPUMS International provides access to harmonized census and survey data from around the world, facilitating cross-national and time-series analyses.
text1: DHS conducts surveys in over 90 countries, collecting data on demographic and health indicators, including maternal and child health, family planning, and infectious diseases.
text2: The BIHS series encompasses comprehensive household surveys conducted in Bangladesh, including iterations in 2011-12, 2015, and 2018-19. These surveys capture data on income, expenditures, living conditions, and socio-economic factors, providing a longitudinal view of changes in household dynamics, economic conditions, and living standards over time.
text5: LSMS is a research program that supports the collection of household survey data, focusing on living standards, poverty, and socio-economic indicators.
text6: The International Household Survey Network (IHSN) Survey Catalog provides a centralized repository of metadata on surveys worldwide, promoting data transparency and accessibility.
text7: The World Bank MicroData Catalog offers access to microdata collected through various surveys, censuses, and administrative systems, supporting research and analysis.
text8: A survey conducted to collect data on household income, expenditures, and consumption patterns, providing insights into economic well-being and living standards.
text9: MICS is a global survey program that collects data on key indicators related to the well-being of children and women, covering health, education, and other social dimensions.
text10: The Labor Force Survey gathers data on employment, unemployment, and other labor market indicators, offering insights into the dynamics of the workforce in a given region or country

title: Replication Data
text0: Harmonization of DMSP and VIIRS Nighttime Light Data (1992-2021):

This database presents harmonized nighttime light data from the Defense Meteorological Satellite Program (DMSP) and Visible Infrared Imaging Radiometer Suite (VIIRS) spanning from 1992 to 2021 on a global scale. Offering a consistent and comprehensive view of nighttime illumination over time, this resource facilitates research and analysis of trends and changes in human activity, urbanization, and environmental dynamics worldwide.

title: Regional Data
text0: The OECD Data database provides a comprehensive collection of economic, social, and environmental statistics from member countries, offering insights into global trends and policy analyses.
text1: Data Africa is a platform offering diverse datasets related to African countries, encompassing socio-economic indicators, demographics, and other crucial data for research and development initiatives.
text2: Eurostat's database offers a wealth of statistical information covering the European Union, providing data on demographics, economics, and other key indicators for informed decision-making and analysis.
text3: Estadísticas e indicadores - CEPALSTAT Bases de Datos y Publicaciones Estadísticas

CEPALSTAT, managed by the Economic Commission for Latin America and the Caribbean (CEPAL), is a database providing statistical information and indicators for countries in the region, supporting research and policy formulation
text4: The South Asian Regional Micro Database serves as a repository for micro-level data, offering detailed insights into socio-economic indicators across South Asian countries. This database supports in-depth analyses and research, contributing to a better understanding of regional trends and facilitating evidence-based decision-making.

title: Dataverses
text0: EASY is a platform for publishing and accessing datasets, simplifying the process of sharing and discovering diverse datasets.
text1: Harvard Dataverse is a data repository facilitating the sharing, archiving, and collaboration on research data across various disciplines.
text2: Mendeley Data provides a platform for researchers to store, share, and collaborate on datasets, enhancing accessibility and fostering collaboration.
text3: The Humanitarian Data Exchange is a platform for sharing and accessing datasets related to humanitarian crises, promoting data-driven decision-making in emergency response.
text4: A repository focused on global health, this exchange platform facilitates the sharing of health-related datasets, fostering collaboration and research in the field.
text5: Zenodo is an open-access repository for research data, providing a platform for researchers to share and preserve their datasets across various disciplines.
